title: How to Do a Magikarp Sweep

steps.headline: Obtain the following Pokémon with the following moves:
steps.description: A Snorlax with Belly Drum A Parasect with Spore A Girafarig with Baton Pass A Sentret with Substitute A Smeargle with Sketch

steps.headline: Enter a double battle with your Snorlax and Smeargle in the first two slots of your party.
steps.description: From there, have Snorlax use Belly Drum and have Smeargle Sketch the move. Defeat the trainer. Remember, you can only battle in-game trainers for this to work.

steps.headline: Fly to the Move Remembers house and Re-Teach Smeargle Sketch.
steps.description: You could also level it up 1 to 10 levels to teach it Sketch again.

steps.headline: Enter a in-game double battle again, but this time have Parasect and Smeargle in the first two slots of your team.
steps.description: Have Parasect use Spore and have Smeargle use Sketch. Then defeat the trainer and re-teach Smeargle Sketch again. Keep repeating until your Smeargle knows Belly Drum, Spore, Substitute, and Baton Pass.

steps.headline: Give your Smeargle a Salac Berry to hold during the battle.
Catch a Magikarp.
steps.description: If it is under level 30, level it up so it can learn Flail.

steps.headline: Give the Magikarp a Focus Sash to hold during the battle.
Use Splash or Tackle until your Magikarp is on 1 HP.
steps.description: When it is, withdraw it and send in Smeargle.

steps.headline: Have Smeargle use Spore to put the target to sleep.
Use Belly Drum, Substitute, and Baton Pass onto Magikarp (Magikarp will now inherit all stat changes of Smeargle).
steps.description: If the target stays asleep, great, but if the target wakes up, you will have a substitute to take any damage of the attacker.

steps.headline: Have Magikarp use Flail.
steps.description: It should result in a OHKO with every Pokémon. You win!

text: Prepare your Pokémon team Obtain the following Pokémon with the following moves: A Snorlax with Belly Drum A Parasect with Spore A Girafarig with Baton Pass A Sentret with Substitute A Smeargle with Sketch Enter a double battle with your Snorlax and Smeargle in the first two slots of your party. From there, have Snorlax use Belly Drum and have Smeargle Sketch the move. Defeat the trainer. Remember, you can only battle in-game trainers for this to work. Fly to the Move Remembers house and Re-Teach Smeargle Sketch. You could also level it up 1 to 10 levels to teach it Sketch again. Enter a in-game double battle again, but this time have Parasect and Smeargle in the first two slots of your team. Have Parasect use Spore and have Smeargle use Sketch. Then defeat the trainer and re-teach Smeargle Sketch again. Keep repeating until your Smeargle knows Belly Drum, Spore, Substitute, and Baton Pass. Give your Smeargle a Salac Berry to hold during the battle.  Catch a Magikarp. If it is under level 30, level it up so it can learn Flail. Give the Magikarp a Focus Sash to hold during the battle.  The Battle Use Splash or Tackle until your Magikarp is on 1 HP. When it is, withdraw it and send in Smeargle. Have Smeargle use Spore to put the target to sleep.  Use Belly Drum, Substitute, and Baton Pass onto Magikarp (Magikarp will now inherit all stat changes of Smeargle). If the target stays asleep, great, but if the target wakes up, you will have a substitute to take any damage of the attacker. Have Magikarp use Flail. It should result in a OHKO with every Pokémon. You win!
